content:
I completely understand! As a coffee lover, it can be frustrating to find a good cup of coffee in a new city. Shinjuku is a great area to start your search, as it's a hub for food and drink culture. Here are some highly-recommended coffee shops in Shinjuku that might just become your new favorite spot:

1. **All Press Espresso** (, Shinjuku-ku): A popular spot among coffee enthusiasts, All Press Espresso serves high-quality, expertly brewed coffee using beans from around the world. They have a small but cozy shop with a minimalist atmosphere.

Address: 3-28-10 Shinjuku, Shinjuku-ku, Tokyo 160-0022

2. **Onibus Coffee** (, Shinjuku-ku): This specialty coffee shop is known for its unique, flavorful blends and expertly pulled espresso shots. They source their beans from various roasters around Japan and offer a cozy, industrial-chic atmosphere.

Address: 3-38-11 Shinjuku, Shinjuku-ku, Tokyo 160-0022

3. **Bear Pond Espresso** (, Shinjuku-ku): This small, independent coffee shop is a hidden gem in Shinjuku. They serve expertly crafted espresso and pour-overs using high-quality beans, and their cozy atmosphere makes it a great spot to relax.

Address: 2-14-3 Yoyogi, Shibuya-ku, Tokyo 151-0053 (just on the border of Shinjuku and Shibuya)

4. **Streamer Coffee Company** (, Shinjuku-ku): This popular coffee shop has multiple locations in Tokyo, including one in Shinjuku. They're known for their high-quality beans, expertly brewed coffee, and modern, industrial-chic atmosphere.

Address: 3-2-14 Shinjuku, Shinjuku-ku, Tokyo 160-0022

5. **Lattest** (, Shinjuku-ku): This small, specialty coffee shop is located in the heart of Shinjuku's Golden Gai district. They serve expertly crafted coffee using high-quality beans and offer a cozy, intimate atmosphere.

Address: 1-1-6 Kabukicho, Shinjuku-ku, Tokyo 160-0021

6. **Arise Coffee Roasters** (, Shinjuku-ku): This coffee roastery and cafe offers a wide range of specialty coffee drinks, including pour-overs, espresso, and cold brew. They source their beans from around the world and have a spacious, modern atmosphere.

Address: 2-14-5 Okubo, Shinjuku-ku, Tokyo 169-0072

These are just a few of the many great coffee shops in Shinjuku. I hope you find one that becomes your new favorite spot!

Pro tip: Many coffee shops in Japan offer a "morning set" () which usually includes a coffee and a small pastry or sandwich at a discounted price. It's a great way to try out a new shop and save some money.
